summary: This is an email chain from April 3, 2020, where attorney Sarah Coyne forwards a message to an unnamed recipient regarding a motion for sentence reduction for an unnamed female client. The client attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. Coyne attaches a portion of the motion discussing this assistance and seeks the recipient's input to avoid misrepresentation.

persons.name: Sarah Coyne
persons.context: Attorney sending an email about filing a motion for sentence reduction for an unnamed female client who attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a death investigation by the SDNY that an unnamed female client attempted to cooperate with.

connections.description: Sarah Coyne is the attorney representing an unnamed female client and is filing a motion for sentence reduction on her behalf.
The unnamed female client attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death, implying some prior connection or knowledge.

events.title: Email regarding sentence reduction motion
events.description: Attorney Sarah Coyne emails an unnamed recipient about filing a sealed motion to reduce the sentence of an unnamed female client, citing the client's attempted cooperation with the SDNY Epstein death investigation.

keyFacts: An unnamed female individual, represented by attorney Sarah Coyne, attempted to cooperate with the SDNY investigation into the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Sarah Coyne was preparing to file a sealed motion under Rule 35 to have this individual's sentence reduced based on this attempted cooperation.
Coyne sought to coordinate with the SDNY prosecutor to ensure the motion accurately characterized the client's assistance and the government's position.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings and attempts at cooperation related to the Epstein case as of April 2020.
